intro: Schizostylis coccinea, commonly known as the red-stemmed orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking red stems and showy, orchid-like flowers. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in spring and are pollinated by insects, particularly bees and butterflies. Schizostylis coccinea is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant colors and unique appearance.
